content.description: The steep orange arete to the left of the buttress where "Pearly Queen" is located. Perhaps the best route on the crag and possibly unrepeated since 1985.
content.protection: Quick draws, a few pieces of trad gear
content.location: On the second tier of the Dinosaur Crag, on the arete immediately left of "Pearly Queen".

content.description: Easy roof to a well protected crack. A little more sketch getting to the anchors.
content.protection: Regular rack. Build anchors on top.
content.location: Roof and crack to the immediate right of "Acid House"

content.description: Alternate 5.11b friction TR variation to the left of "Dinosaur Exhibit". Tiny edges down low, slick gold friction up high.
content.protection: Build TR anchors using trad gear at approximately the same location as those for "Dinosaur Exhibit".
content.location: Runs up the face to the left of "Dinosaur Exhibit".

content.description: Tips crack leading over a small roof onto a clean, polished slab. The 5.11c thin crux involves finger jams to pull over the roof.
content.location: On the far right side of the Dinosaur Crag off the ledge running across the cliff. "Lizard Princess" (5.7) can be used as an approach pitch.

content.description: Clean hand crack with the well-protected 5.7 crux near the bottom. Can be climbed to access "Pearly Queen" (5.11c tips) on the tier above.
content.location: LP is the last crack on the right-hand side of the lower tier on the Dinosaur Crag.

content.description: There are two spectacular grooves that can be top-roped up the center of the 60 ft buttress. The left one goes at 5.10b with a 5.11b direct start. The right groove is 5.10d.
content.protection: Build natural TR anchors in the back of the ledge on top.
content.location: Up grooves on the corrugated buttress between "Acid House" (5.10a) and "Lizard Princess" (5.7)

content.description: Slab friction climb off the top of a platform and little left of center on the Dinosaur Crag. Discontinuous creases leading to a friction crux above the second of the two protection bolts. One of the best climbs on the whole crag.
content.protection: Trad gear plus 2 quick draws for the protection bolts up high on the slab. Build a natural anchor on top.
content.location: A little left of center on the cleanest section of the Dinosaur Crag. Descend across the big ledge to the west.

content.description: Climb a clean 5.6 dihedral leading up to a 5.8+ hand crack finish on a broad flat ledge on the top of the Dinosaur Crag. Walk off to the west.
content.location: Starts in an obvious, clean 5.6 dihedral on the extreme left edge of the Dinosaur Crag.

content.description: Goes over the small roof just right of "Dinosaur Exhibit" and continues up a series of right slanting thin crack leading to the top of the ledge half way up the crag.
content.protection: Tiny to small. Build natural anchors on the broad ledge at the top.
content.location: First route to the right of "Dinosaur Exhibit".
